main.enactingFormula: (Cap. 313, section 80 and Cap. 313 sub. leg. A, regulation 72(1))

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Shipping and Port Control Regulations.

subsection.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: aground (擱淺) includes beached; (L.N. 408 of 1994)
all-round light (環照燈) means a light showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 360 degrees;
cable reserve (電纜留用區) means an area of the waters of Hong Kong specified as such in the Sixth Schedule;
dangerous goods anchorage (危險品碇泊處) means an area of the waters of Hong Kong specified as such in the Seventh Schedule;
immigration anchorage (入境船隻碇泊處) means an approved immigration anchorage under the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115);
naval anchorage (海軍碇泊處) means an area of the waters of Hong Kong specified as such in the Seventh Schedule;
principal fairway (主要航道) means any area of the waters of Hong Kong specified as such in the Third Schedule;
private mooring (私人繫泊設備) means a mooring which is not a Government mooring;
quarantine anchorage (檢疫碇泊處) means an area of the waters of Hong Kong specified as such in the Seventh Schedule;
seatrial (海上試航) means any seatrial conducted or completed in the waters of Hong Kong for the purpose (whether the sole purpose or otherwise) of testing the performance of a vessel; (L.N. 408 of 1994)
special anchorage (專用碇泊處) means any area of the waters of Hong Kong specified as such in the Seventh Schedule;
timber storage pound (貯木所) means an area of the waters of Hong Kong approved under regulation 58 for the storage of logs and other timber;

underway (在航) has the same meaning as in Rule 3(i) of Part A of the Schedule to the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (Signals of Distress and Prevention of Collisions) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. N); (L.N. 408 of 1994; E.R. 4 of 2023)
Victoria port (維多利亞港口) means the area of the waters of Hong Kong declared under section 56 of the Ordinance as Victoria port;
Yau Ma Tei Anchorage (油麻地碇泊處) means the area of the waters of Hong Kong specified as such in the Seventh Schedule.

subsection.content: References in these regulations to the master of any ship or vessel shall be treated as including references to the master of any ship or vessel of a type, description or class as may be specified by the Director by notice in the Gazette. (L.N. 408 of 1994)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: advice (報知) means advice communicated to a vessel from an authorized officer at the vessel traffic centre, and identified by the call sign “MARDEP” or “MARDEP, HONG KONG”;

arrival (到達), in relation to a vessel entering the waters of Hong Kong, means the first occasion on which a vessel ceases to be underway after entering those waters from sea or river trade waters, as the case may be, and arrive (到達) shall be construed accordingly;
call sign (呼叫信號) has the same meaning as in the Radio Regulations;

calling-in point (召集站) means an identifiable position (whether so identifiable by reference to a lighthouse, light, buoy, pilot boarding station, island, headland or otherwise) situated in the waters of Hong Kong, and specified as such in the Tenth Schedule;

departure (開出), in relation to a vessel leaving the waters of Hong Kong, means the departure of that vessel from any berth to sea or river trade waters, as the case may be, and depart (開出) shall be construed accordingly;

inbound (返航的), in relation to the intended entry of a vessel into the waters of Hong Kong, means the inward passage of that vessel into those waters from sea or river trade waters, as the case may be;

MARDEP or MARDEP, HONG KONG means the call sign of the Marine Department of the Hong Kong Government transmitted as such for the purpose of commencing VHF radiotelephone communication between a vessel and an authorized officer at the vessel traffic centre;

def.name: Movement
def.leadIn: movement (移動), in relation to a vessel in the waters of Hong Kong, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the movement of that vessel between one berth (original berth) and another berth, or between the original berth, some other intermediate location within the waters of Hong Kong and the original berth, as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the movement by way of navigation of that vessel for the purpose of conducting a seatrial, other than a seatrial conducted or completed immediately prior to that vessel leaving the waters of Hong Kong,

def.continued: and move (移動) shall be construed accordingly;

section.def: notification (知會) means a written document addressed to the Director, and includes a letter, cable, telex or facsimile transmission, and notify (知會) shall be construed accordingly;

outbound (出航的), in relation to the intended departure of a vessel from the waters of Hong Kong, means the outward passage of that vessel from those waters to sea or river trade waters, as the case may be;
pilot boarding station (領港員登船區) has the same meaning as in section 10A of the Pilotage Ordinance (Cap. 84);
port clearance (出港證) means a port clearance referred to in section 15(1) of the Ordinance;

Radio Regulations (無線電規則) means the Radio Regulations complementing the Constitution and Convention of the International Telecommunication Union as in force from time to time; (36 of 2000 s. 28; L.N. 124 of 2024)

report (報告) means a message, identified by the call sign “MARDEP” or “MARDEP, HONG KONG” and the call sign of a vessel, transmitted by VHF radiotelephone communication from that vessel to the vessel traffic centre;
river trade waters (內河通航水域) means the waters contained within river trade limits other than the waters of Hong Kong contained within those limits;
seaward limits of the vessel traffic service coverage (船隻航行監察服務範圍的朝海界限) means the limits delineated in the Fifteenth Schedule specifying the extent of the coverage of the vessel traffic service;

def.name: SpecialCondition
def.leadIn: special condition (特殊狀況), in relation to a vessel, means any such condition relating to— (L.N. 171 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the abnormal stability of a vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any trimming, heeling or listing of a vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any deficiency of a vessel’s propulsion or steering gear, anchors or windlass;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the breach of, or damage to, a vessel’s hull which may affect the water-tight integrity of the vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the abnormal state of a vessel’s cargo; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the breakdown of a vessel’s radar or other aid to navigation of a major nature;

section.def: standard marine navigation vocabulary (標準航海詞匯) means the Standard Marine Navigation Vocabulary adopted by the International Maritime Organisation Assembly and currently in force;
vessel not under command (失控船隻) means a vessel which is unable to manoeuvre in accordance with collision regulations;

vessel traffic centre (船隻航行監察中心) means the vessel traffic centre (identified by the call sign “MARDEP” or “MARDEP, HONG KONG”) from which the vessel traffic service of Hong Kong is operated and to which reports are made;
vessel traffic service (船隻航行監察服務) means the vessel traffic service of Hong Kong operated by the Director in respect of vessels within the seaward limits of the vessel traffic service coverage;
VHF (甚高頻) means very high frequency;

VHF channel (甚高頻頻道), in relation to VHF radiotelephone communication, means any radiotelephone channel in the VHF band provided for in the Radio Regulations and specified as such in column 1 of the First Schedule;
VHF sector (甚高頻區段) means any VHF sector the boundaries of which are delineated in the Second Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: This Part, other than regulation 6A, applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a vessel of over 300 gross tonnage;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a vessel of 300 gross tonnage or less and which is the subject of a direction given by the Director under section 16 of the Ordinance; (24 of 2005 s. 55)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vessel of 300 gross tonnage or less and which is the subject of a requirement made by the Director or an authorized officer at the vessel traffic centre to participate in the vessel traffic service. (24 of 2005 s. 55)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (3), regulation 6A applies to any vessel, whatever its tonnage, other than the following vessels— (24 of 2005 s. 55)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ferry vessel within the meaning of regulation 2 of the Shipping and Port Control (Ferry Terminals) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. H).

subsection.content: Regulation 6A applies to a vessel referred to in paragraph (2)(b) if it is the subject of a direction given by the Director under section 16 of the Ordinance.
Every vessel shall have on board radiotelephone equipment that is capable of operation in the VHF band on the channels specified in the First Schedule. (L.N. 408 of 1994)
The radiotelephone equipment shall at all times be maintained in good working condition and shall be available for operation on the navigational bridge of a vessel.
Any VHF radiotelephone communication required to be made under this Part shall, so far as practicable, be communicated in accordance with the Radio Regulations.
Any VHF radiotelephone communication made by the master of a vessel shall be communicated to the vessel traffic centre and identified by the call sign “MARDEP” or “MARDEP, HONG KONG”.

Any VHF radiotelephone communication made by the master of a vessel within any VHF sector described in column 2 of the First Schedule shall be communicated on the VHF channel specified opposite thereto in column 1 of that Schedule.

No intership VHF radiotelephone communication shall be made by any person in the waters of Hong Kong except in accordance with section 10 of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106). (36 of 2000 s. 28)

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Pre-arrival notification or report for permission to enter the waters of Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (2), the owner or his local agent or the master of a vessel to which this regulation applies shall— (24 of 2005 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not less than 24 hours before the intended entry of that vessel into the waters of Hong Kong from sea or river trade waters, as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where that vessel leaves its last port of call less than 24 hours before that intended entry immediately after so leaving,

subsection.continued: apply to the Director for permission for that vessel to enter the waters of Hong Kong by notification and provide the information specified in the Sixteenth Schedule in that notification.

subsection.content: Where the owner, agent or master of the vessel is unable to comply with paragraph (1) by means of notification because of the proximity of that vessel’s last port of call to the waters of Hong Kong, the master of that vessel shall, immediately after the vessel leaves that last port of call on a course to enter those waters, report the information specified in the Sixteenth Schedule to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector into which that vessel is to enter those waters, and apply for permission to so enter those waters.

The Director may, on receiving an application under this regulation, grant the person making the application, permission for the vessel to enter the waters of Hong Kong and provide that person with such information, or give that person such directions (including directions under section 16 of the Ordinance) or instructions, as the case may be, as the Director thinks fit, or the Director may refuse to grant that person such permission.
In complying with paragraph (1) or (2), a master of a vessel shall be deemed to have complied with section 10E of the Pilotage Ordinance (Cap. 84).

section.name: s7
section.heading: Initial report
section.leadIn: Where permission to enter the waters of Hong Kong has been granted under regulation 6A(3), the master of a vessel in respect of that permission whose vessel is on a course to enter those waters from sea or river trade waters, as the case may be, shall, when that vessel is in the vicinity of the seaward limits of the vessel traffic service coverage, report the following information to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector into which that vessel is to enter those waters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the call sign of that vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the national colours of that vessel;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any material changes to information (if any) provided in accordance with regulation 6A;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the present location of that vessel; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other information as may be required by the vessel traffic centre.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Pilot report
section.leadIn: When a vessel embarks or disembarks a pilot in the waters of Hong Kong, the master of the vessel must, on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the embarkation or disembarkation to the vessel traffic centre; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the time of the embarkation or disembarkation and the location of the vessel.

section.name: s8A
section.heading: Arrival report
section.leadIn: When a vessel arrives in the waters of Hong Kong, the master of the vessel must, on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the arrival to the vessel traffic centre; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the time of the arrival and the berth or other location of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Before a vessel gets underway for a movement within the waters of Hong Kong, the master of the vessel must, on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the intended movement to the vessel traffic centre;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request permission to move; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide the vessel traffic centre with all the information specified in paragraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: The following information is specified for the purposes of paragraph (1)(c)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the call sign of the vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the berth or other location of the vessel;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the intended berth or other intended location of the vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any special condition of the vessel;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other relevant information, including the intention of the master of the vessel to undertake a seatrial during the movement.

section.name: s8E
section.heading: Move finished report
section.leadIn: When a vessel ceases to be underway after the master of the vessel has reported an intended movement under regulation 8B, the master must, on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the cessation of the movement of the vessel to the vessel traffic centre; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the time of the cessation and the berth or other location of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Before a vessel gets underway for a departure from the waters of Hong Kong, the master of the vessel must, on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the intended departure to the vessel traffic centre;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request permission to depart; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide the vessel traffic centre with all the information specified in paragraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: The following information is specified for the purposes of paragraph (1)(c)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the call sign of the vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the berth or other location of the vessel;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the number of the port clearance obtained for the vessel under section 15 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any special condition of the vessel;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other relevant information, including the intention of the master of the vessel to undertake a seatrial before the departure.

subsection.content: This regulation applies if, after a report of an intended movement or departure has been made under regulation 8B or 8F, the movement or departure is delayed for any reason.
The master must report the delay to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located.

Where an oral report is not made to the Director in respect of any occurrence under section 67(1) of the Ordinance, the master of the vessel shall report that occurrence to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located.

When a vessel which is underway within the waters of Hong Kong becomes a vessel not under command within the meaning of Rule 3(f) of Part A of the Schedule to the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (Signals of Distress and Prevention of Collisions) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. N), the master of that vessel shall report that condition to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located. (E.R. 4 of 2023)

When a vessel the subject of a report under paragraph (2) ceases to be a vessel not under command, the master of that vessel shall report that condition to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located.

When a vessel which is underway in the waters of Hong Kong encounters any incident involving dangerous goods, the master of that vessel shall report the incident to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Language of reports and vocabulary of communications

subsection.content: Except where the vessel traffic centre permits the use of any other language, all reports shall be made in the English or the Chinese language. (L.N. 408 of 1994; 80 of 1997 s. 128)
Any report in accordance with paragraph (1) shall, so far as practicable, make use of the terms, phrases and expressions contained in the standard marine navigation vocabulary. (L.N. 408 of 1994)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Reference to time
section.leadIn: Where reference to time is made in any report, or in any communication from the vessel traffic centre, the time shall be specified in— (L.N. 408 of 1994)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the 24-hour clock system.

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (2), the master of every vessel that is within the waters of Hong Kong shall maintain continuous listening watch on the radiotelephone on board the vessel on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located. (L.N. 171 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (1) shall not apply when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: transmission by the master of the vessel on that channel is in progress;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permission is granted by the vessel traffic centre to the master of the vessel to transmit on another channel, in which event the listening watch on the radiotelephone shall be maintained continuously on that other channel, except when transmission by the master of the vessel on that other channel is in progress; or (L.N. 408 of 1994)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: permission is granted by the vessel traffic centre to the master of a vessel to suspend the listening watch on the radiotelephone.

subsection.leadIn: Where in the opinion of an authorized officer at the vessel traffic centre there exists in the waters of Hong Kong any of the conditions specified in paragraph (2), he may give directions to the master of any vessel specifying the time when and the place where the vessel shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: move within or through; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: depart from,

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (1), the conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vessel traffic congestion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adverse weather;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: reduced visibility; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: other hazardous conditions.

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Observation report
section.leadIn: The master of a vessel within the waters of Hong Kong shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if he observes any circumstances adversely affecting, or likely to adversely affect, any other vessel or aid to navigation within those waters; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if he becomes aware of the existence within those waters of any conditions concerning—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: danger to navigation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: adverse weather;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: reduced visibility;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: serious pollution; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: other adverse phenomenon,

section.continued: report those circumstances or conditions, as the case may be, to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located.

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Calling-in point report
section.content: When a vessel is in the vicinity of any calling-in point specified in the Tenth Schedule, the master of that vessel shall report the identity of that calling-in point, and the position of the vessel in relation thereto, to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Authorization to deviate from this Part

subsection.content: An authorized officer at the vessel traffic centre may upon request from a master of a vessel grant permission to the master to deviate from any provision of or direction given under this Part and shall specify the manner in which such deviation may be made. (L.N. 408 of 1994)
A master shall, in making a request under paragraph (1), state the manner in which he wishes to deviate from any particular provision of or direction given under this Part and the need for doing so.

The granting of permission under paragraph (1) shall not diminish or in any way affect the responsibility of the master to whom the permission is granted in relation to his vessel, persons on board, its cargo or any other person or property.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Deviation from this Part in emergencies

subsection.content: A master of a vessel may, in any emergency affecting the safety of life or property, deviate from any provision of or direction given under this Part, or any permission granted under regulation 13, to the extent necessary to avoid endangering persons, property or the environment.

Where a master deviates from any provision of or direction given under this Part, or is unable, for whatever reason, to comply with any permission granted under regulation 13, he shall report that deviation or non-compliance, as the case may be, to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located. (L.N. 408 of 1994; L.N. 171 of 2017)

section.name: s14A
section.heading: Advice from the vessel traffic centre
section.content: If at any time an authorized officer at the vessel traffic centre communicates to the master of a vessel within the waters of Hong Kong advice in respect of circumstances or conditions relating to, or likely to relate to, the vessel, the master of that vessel shall report his intentions in respect of that advice to the vessel traffic centre on the VHF channel appropriate to the VHF sector in which the vessel is located.

subsection.content: If for any reason it is not possible to operate the radiotelephone equipment carried on board a vessel, the master shall at the earliest practicable time restore it or cause it to be restored to effective operating condition.

subsection.leadIn: During the time it is not possible to operate the radiotelephone equipment carried on board a vessel—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subject to subparagraph (c), compliance with regulation 7, 8, 8A, 8B, 8E, 8F, 8I, 12A, 12B or 14A (prescribed regulation) is not required; and (L.N. 171 of 2017)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if it is possible for the master of the vessel to make the report required by a prescribed regulation by telephone or another means—

subparagraph.content: compliance with the prescribed regulation is required; and
it is sufficient compliance with the requirement under the prescribed regulation to make a report on a VHF channel if the report is instead made by telephone or the other means. (L.N. 171 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: A master shall as soon as practicable inform the Director or the vessel traffic centre—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is not possible to operate the radiotelephone equipment carried on board the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when such radiotelephone equipment is restored to effective operating condition.

subsection.content: If without reasonable excuse regulation 5 or 6A is contravened, the owner and the master of the vessel commit an offence and each of them is liable to a fine at level 5.
If without reasonable excuse regulation 8, 8A, 8B, 8E, 8F, 8I, 9, 10, 12B, 14A or 15 is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3. (L.N. 171 of 2017)
If without reasonable excuse a master contravenes regulation 6, 7, 8J, 11, 12A or 14(2) he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4.

If without reasonable excuse a master fails to comply with any direction given to him under regulation 12 or any permission granted under regulation 13 he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

Without prejudice to paragraph (2), no high speed craft shall, when underway in the waters of Hong Kong between half an hour after sunset and half an hour before sunrise, proceed at a speed exceeding the maximum permitted speed provided in paragraph 1 of the Fourth Schedule, except with the permission in writing from the Director. (L.N. 51 of 1992)

Every vessel underway in the waters of Hong Kong shall proceed with caution and, unless the Director otherwise permits, at a speed not exceeding the maximum permitted speed provided in paragraph 2 of the Fourth Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Also, a vessel underway in a restricted zone mentioned below must not proceed at a speed exceeding the maximum permitted speed provided in paragraph 3 of the Fourth Schedule during the period specified below—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a restricted zone specified in items 1 and 2 (other than paragraph (c)) of Schedule 18—the period from 8 a.m. to 12 midnight on—

subparagraph.content: any Saturday or public holiday; and
any day from 1 July to 15 September (both days inclusive);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the restricted zone specified in item 2(c) of Schedule 18—the period from 8 a.m. to 12 midnight; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a restricted zone specified in items 3, 4, 5 and 6 of Schedule 18—the period from 8 a.m. to 12 midnight on—

subparagraph.content: any Saturday or public holiday; and
any day from 1 April to 31 October (both days inclusive). (L.N. 140 of 2019)

subsection.content: Also, no vessel shall, when underway in the entrance to or within a typhoon shelter specified in the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Typhoon Shelters) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. E), proceed at a speed exceeding the maximum permitted speed provided in paragraph 4 of the Fourth Schedule. (L.N. 107 of 2000; 24 of 2005 s. 55; L.N. 140 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: If without reasonable excuse, paragraph (1), (2), (3) or (4) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable in the case of a contravention of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: paragraph (1) or (2), to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: paragraph (3), to a fine at level 3; (L.N. 140 of 2019)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: paragraph (4), to a fine at level 2. (L.N. 107 of 2000)

subsection.def: In this regulation, high speed craft (高速船) has the meaning assigned to it by the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (High Speed Craft) Regulation (Cap. 369 sub. leg. AW). (L.N. 107 of 2000)

subsection.content: Any vessel underway to which the international code signal “L” is made by flag, sound or flashing lamp from a marine, police, immigration or customs and excise department launch or a signal station, or to which any signal prescribed in regulation 35 is exhibited from a police launch, shall stop until authorized to proceed.

Any vessel not underway to which the international code signal “L” is made in the manner specified in paragraph (1), or to which any signal prescribed in regulation 35 is exhibited from a police launch, shall not move from its position until authorized to do so.
If without reasonable excuse this regulation is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (E.R. 4 of 2023)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Restriction on embarkation or disembarkation of pilots

subsection.content: No vessel shall when entering Victoria port embark, or when leaving it disembark, a pilot outside the port within a distance of one nautical mile from the centre of the Lei Yue Mun Pass or Sulphur Channel.
If without reasonable excuse this regulation is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2. (E.R. 4 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraphs (3) and (4), when a ship arrives (within the meaning of Part II) in the waters of Hong Kong, the owner of the ship, or if the owner is not in Hong Kong his agent, shall within 24 hours after such arrival—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report at the office of the Director the arrival of the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: deposit at the office of the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the ship’s clearance from the last port of call;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if cargo is to be discharged or transhipped, a copy of the manifest of such cargo;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a list of the passengers on board (if any);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a list of crew; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: such other documents as the Director may require; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a ship belonging to a nation not having a consular officer in Hong Kong— (64 of 1999 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: produce at the office of the Director the certificate of registry of the ship;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: deposit at the office of the Director the ship’s articles.

subsection.content: If the owner of a ship or his agent is not in Hong Kong, paragraph (1) shall be complied with by the master of the ship.

Paragraph (1) shall not apply to any ship for the time being used by the Hong Kong Government, or to any warship or ship for the time being used by the Chinese People’s Liberation Army, the Central People’s Government or the Government of any State for other than commercial purposes. (2 of 2012 s. 3)
Any owner, agent or master who without reasonable excuse contravenes this regulation commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3. (E.R. 4 of 2023)
